name: The Artwork in the Age of Mechanical Reproduction

metadata.name: The Artwork in the Age of Mechanical Reproduction #42
metadata.description:
Walter Benjamin proclaimed that the mechanical reproduction devalues the aura (uniqueness) of an objet d'art. 
Was he right?
This is a collection of 325 high-res pixelated Mona Lisas. 
The single pixel exists in 25 copys. The more detailed the artwork gets, the rarer the copys exist. In the end the full-res Mona Lisa only exists one time. What is worth more? The concept or the reproduction?
